message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

//...

int xWins = 0;
int oWins = 0;

//...

if(win == true){
    if(letter.equals("X")) {
        xWins++;
    } else if(letter.equals("O")) {
        oWins++;
    }
    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, letter + " Won!");
    try {
        PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("results.txt", true));
        writer.write("X wins: " + xWins + ", O wins: " + oWins + "\n");
        writer.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    System.exit(0);
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
In the given code, we first import the necessary classes for writing to a file. We then declare two integer variables, `xWins` and `oWins`, to keep track of the number of wins for each player. 

In the `if(win == true)` block, we increment the appropriate win counter depending on the value of `letter`. 

We then use a `PrintWriter` to write the results to a file named "results.txt". The `FileWriter` is constructed with two arguments: the name of the file, and a boolean indicating whether or not to append to the file. If the boolean is `true`, the results will be appended to the file; if `false`, the file will be overwritten each time. 

The `write` method of `PrintWriter` is then used to write a string to the file, which includes the number of wins for each player. 

Finally, the `PrintWriter` is closed to free up system resources and ensure that all changes are written to the file. 

If an `IOException` is thrown at any point during this process, it is caught and its stack trace is printed to the console.

Question: How to save results into the text file?: :This question already has answers here:                                                            How to save results from the game to text file [closed]                                (2 answers)                            Closed 10 years ago.here is the tic tac toe game in java, can somebody explain how to save how many times win X and how many times O into the text file, I looked at similar threads but I don't know how to make it in this case. Sorry for the duplicate, didnt know how to update last question.package xo2;import java.awt.*;import java.awt.event.*;import javax.swing.*;public class XO2 implements ActionListener {private int[][] winningCombination = new int[][] {        {0, 1, 2},                    {3, 4, 5},                    {6, 7, 8},         {0, 3, 6},                    {1, 4, 7},                    {2, 5, 8},         {0, 4, 8},                    {3, 4, 6}            };private JFrame window = new JFrame("Tic Tac Toe");private JButton buttons[] = new JButton[9];private int count = 0;private String letter = "";private boolean win = false;public XO2(){    window.setSize(300,300);    window.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);    window.setLayout(new GridLayout(3,3));    for(int i=0; i<9; i++){        buttons[i] = new JButton();        window.add(buttons[i]);        buttons[i].addActionListener(this);    }    window.setVisible(true);}public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent a) {    count++;    if(count % 2 == 0){        letter = "O";    }    else {        letter = "X";    }    JButton pressedButton = (JButton)a.getSource();    pressedButton.setText(letter);    pressedButton.setEnabled(false);    for(int i=0; i<8; i++){        if( buttons[winningCombination[i][0]].getText().equals(buttons[winningCombination[i][1]].getText()) &&                buttons[winningCombination[i][1]].getText().equals(buttons[winningCombination[i][2]].getText()) &&                !buttons[winningCombination[i][0]].getText().equals("")){            win = true;        }    }    if(win == true){        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, letter + " Won!");        System.exit(0);    } else if(count == 9 && win == false){        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Draw!");        System.exit(0);    }}public static void main(String[] args){    XO2 starter = new XO2();}}
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
